value.title: Full-stack end-to-end monitoring with Azure Monitor | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Rahul Bagaria joins Lara Rubbelke to discuss Azure Monitor, which now includes Log Analytics and Application Insights. Azure Monitor provides full stack monitoring tools for collecting and analyzing telemetry that allow you to maximize the performance and availability of your cloud and on-premises resources

value.title: How to host a static website with Azure Storage | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, learn how you can host a static website running in Azure Storage in a few steps.     For more tips and tricks, visit: http://azuredev.tips     Get started with 12 months of free services and $200 USD in credit. Create your free account today with Microsoft Azure:

value.title: How to use Azure Automation with PowerShell | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, learn how to use Azure Automation with a Windows Machine with PowerShell. Azure Automation makes it easy to do common tasks like, scaling Azure SQL Database up and down and starting and stopping a virtual machine.   For more tips and tricks, visit: http://azuredev.tips

value.title: How to use Azure Bastion to connect securely to your Azure VMs | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Using a bastion host can help limit threats such as port scanning and other types of malware targeting your VMs. Ashish Jain joins Scott Hanselman to show how Azure Bastion gives you secure and seamless RDP and SSH access to your virtual machines. Now you can securely access your VMs over SSL from the

value.title: Introducing new Azure API Management capabilities | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Miao Jiang joins Scott Hanselman discuss the API economy and how companies must master the challenges inherent in building, maintaining, managing, and exposing APIs to participate. That's where Azure API Management can help. Azure API Management is a solution for publishing APIs to external and internal

value.title: Using Entity Framework Core with Azure SQL DB and Azure Cosmos DB | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Jeremy Likness shows Scott Hanselman how to use Entity Framework (EF) Core with Azure SQL DB and Azure Cosmos DB. EF Core is a lightweight, extensible, open source, and cross-platform version of the popular Entity Framework data access technology.  0:00 – Overview 1:43 – Using Entity Framework Core with
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/FFgS_k_Muk8" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Implement a Data Streaming Solution with Azure Streaming Analytics
value.excerpt: In this learning path, discover Azure Stream Analytics streaming data, the concepts of event processing, and integration of Internet of Things (IoT) devices.

topItems.title: Work with data streams by using Azure Stream Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Explore how Azure Stream Analytics integrates with your applications or Internet of Things devices to gain insights with real-time streaming data.

topItems.title: Transform data by using Azure Stream Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create Azure Stream Analytics jobs to process input data, transform it with a query, and return results

value.title: Large-Scale Data Processing with Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2
value.excerpt: With this learning path, you'll use Azure Data Lake Storage to process your Big Data efficiently and easily while also being protected by Azure’s host of security features.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure Data Lake storage
topItems.excerpt: Discover how Data Lake Storage provides a repository where you can upload and store unstructured data bringing new efficiencies to processing big data analytics.

topItems.title: Upload data to Azure Data Lake Storage
topItems.excerpt: Learn about creating an Azure Data Lake Storage account and uploading data to Data Lake Storage Gen 2 through the Azure Storage Explorer.

topItems.title: Secure your Azure Storage account
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure Storage provides multilayered security to protect your data with access keys, secure networks, and Advanced Threat Protection monitoring.

value.title: Allow users to reset their password with Azure Active Directory self-service password reset
value.excerpt: Learn how to allow users to reset their password with Azure Active Directory self-service password reset.

value.title: Analyze images with the Computer Vision service
value.excerpt: The Computer Vision service enables software engineers to create intelligent solutions that extract information from images; a common task in many artificial intelligence (AI) scenarios.

value.title: Analyze your Azure infrastructure by using Azure Monitor logs
value.excerpt: Use Azure Monitor logs to extract valuable information about your infrastructure from log data.

value.title: Create a long-running serverless workflow with Durable Functions
value.excerpt: Learn how to orchestrate a long-running workflow as a set of activities using scalable and cost-effective Durable Functions.

value.title: Microsoft Azure IoT strategy and solutions
value.excerpt: This module provides an overview of Azure IoT, and describes Microsoft tools, services, and infrastructure. This knowledge can help bring IoT to life for your organization and customers.

value.title: Scale multiple Azure SQL Databases with SQL elastic pools
value.excerpt: Learn how to create SQL elastic pools and how to use them to manage performance and cost for a collection of SQL databases.

value.title: Introduction to Azure SQL
value.excerpt: This module introduces Azure SQL. Learn about various deployment options and service tiers and what to use for your organization.

value.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Cost optimization
value.excerpt: Learn how to use the cost optimization pillar of the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework to design a cloud-based architecture that is efficient, eliminates waste, and gives you full visibility into where your money is spent on cloud resources.

value.title: Introduction to the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework
value.excerpt: Learn how using key principles throughout your cloud architecture can help you design and build a solid architectural foundation that you can continuously improve.

value.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Performance efficiency
value.excerpt: Learn how to adjust your capacity based on workload and how to optimize network performance, storage, and database performance.

value.title: Learn how to use Solidity
value.excerpt: Discover how Solidity can help you program smart contracts for the Ethereum blockchain platform.

value.title: Build Azure Resource Manager templates
value.excerpt: Learn how Resource Manager templates express your deployments as code, enabling you to deploy faster and more reliably.

value.title: Understand virtualization
value.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Take a deep dive into virtualization by understanding its formal definition as well as the different types of virtual machines.

value.title: Configure and manage secrets in Azure Key Vault
value.excerpt: Configure and manage secrets in Azure Key Vault

value.title: Connect an app to Azure Storage
value.excerpt: Create a simple application and add configuration, client library references, and C# or JavaScript code to connect it to Azure Storage.

value.title: Control Azure services with the CLI
value.excerpt: Learn the steps to install the Azure CLI locally, create a website, and manage Azure resources using the CLI.

value.title: Describe Azure Databricks
value.excerpt: Describe Azure Databricks

value.title: Design a data warehouse with Azure Synapse Analytics
value.excerpt: Learn how to create a data warehouse in Azure Synapse Analytics in minutes to take advantage of massively parallel processing (MPP) and run complex queries at petabyte scale quickly
